snippet: The network equipment maker attributed the sales decline to weak demand in emerging markets and business uncertainty in America.
abstract: Cisco Systems warns its revenue will decline 8 to 10 percent in its second fiscal quarter, mainly because of weak demand in emerging markets; reports first-quarter revenue rose 2 percent to $12.09 billion, from $11.88 billion in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The network equipment maker attributed the sales decline to weak demand in emerging markets and business uncertainty in America.

headline.main: Cisco Expects a Decline in Revenue of Up to 10%
headline.print_headline: Cisco Expects A Decline In Revenue Of Up to 10%
